definition: to pass on/to hand down/tradition has it that .../according to legend
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
biography/historical narrative/commentaries/relay station
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
lit. the flame of a burning piece of firewood passes on to the rest (idiom)/fig. (of knowledge, skill etc) to be passed on from teachers to students, one generation to another

sentences.english: Legend has it that there was a devil in Dynasty of Dong Han.
sentences.chinese: 相傳，在東漢時期有一妖怪爲禍人間。

sentences.english: He also insinuates that the oral tradition from which the Gospels originated was flawed.
sentences.chinese: 他還暗示，福音書因爲口口相傳是有缺陷的。

sentences.english: They will become the "torch carriers" for China-ASEAN friendship.
sentences.chinese: 他們將成爲中國和東盟友誼薪火相傳的光明使者。

sentences.english: It is said the origin of face changing has something to do with the resistance of wild beasts.
sentences.chinese: 相傳“變臉”的由來與古代人們應對野獸侵犯有關。

sentences.english: Following the sea is the tradition of his family.
sentences.chinese: 當海員是他家世代相傳的職業。

sentences.english: This sad love story has passed from generation to generation.
sentences.chinese: 這個悲楚動人的故事一代代相傳。

sentences.english: Legend has it that there is a bar in New York where, in the ladies' room there is a very special mirror.
sentences.chinese: 相傳紐約一個酒吧的女洗手間裏一塊魔鏡。

sentences.english: According to legend, martial arts, martial arts stick up for the day mountain camp.
sentences.chinese: 相傳武林中，武功最高爲天棒山派。

sentences.english: Word of mouth is now the number one marketing channel.
sentences.chinese: 口碑相傳正成爲第一位的市場溝通渠道。

sentences.english: According to legend, during the Han Dynasty, the King of Huainan, Liu An, is especially keen on books about immortals and ghosts.
sentences.chinese: 相傳漢朝的淮南王劉安特別喜愛看描寫神仙鬼怪的書。

sentences.english: However, early music was not handed down from generation to generation or recorded.
sentences.chinese: 然而，早期音樂卻未能代代相傳或記錄下來。

sentences.english: It is storied that Mahasthamaprapta preached in Putuo Mount of Zhejiang.
sentences.chinese: 相傳其顯靈說法的道場在浙江普陀山。

sentences.english: County, Rong Guan camp hydrangea dragon is the way down from generation to generation.
sentences.chinese: 清苑縣戎官營的繡球龍燈，就是這樣代代相傳下來。

sentences.english: This company owes its fine reputation to word-of-mouth advertising.
sentences.chinese: 這家公司的好名聲建立於客戶間口耳相傳的口碑。

sentences.english: This farm has been transferred from father to son for generations .
sentences.chinese: 這個農場父子相傳已有好幾代了。

sentences.english: It was that night, in the Milky Way to wash hair will cowboy.
sentences.chinese: 相傳，這天晚上織女會在銀河洗髮去會牛郎。
